description: Real-time system performance monitoring for hostsrver

targets.rawSql: SELECT ROUND(AVG(cpu_percent), 1) as "Host CPU %" FROM system_metrics WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) AND host_name != 'server'
SELECT ROUND(AVG(memory_percent), 1) as "Host Memory %" FROM system_metrics WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) AND host_name != 'server'
SELECT ROUND(AVG(disk_percent), 1) as "Host Disk %" FROM system_metrics WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) AND host_name != 'server'

WITH latest_host_metrics AS (
    SELECT DISTINCT ON (host_name) 
        host_name,
        uptime_seconds,
        timestamp
    FROM system_metrics 
    WHERE host_name != 'server'
      AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
    ORDER BY host_name, timestamp DESC
)
SELECT 
    ROUND(AVG(uptime_seconds), 0) as "Average Host Uptime"
FROM latest_host_metrics;

WITH all_hosts AS (
  -- Get all hosts that have data in the time range
  SELECT DISTINCT host_name
  FROM system_metrics
  WHERE host_name != 'server'
    AND timestamp >= $__timeFrom()
    AND timestamp <= $__timeTo()
),
uptime_analysis AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    uptime_seconds,
    host_name,
    LAG(uptime_seconds) OVER (PARTITION BY host_name ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_uptime,
    LAG(timestamp) OVER (PARTITION BY host_name ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_timestamp
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name != 'server'
    AND uptime_seconds IS NOT NULL
    AND timestamp >= $__timeFrom()
    AND timestamp <= $__timeTo()
  ORDER BY host_name, timestamp
),
reboot_candidates AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    host_name,
    uptime_seconds,
    prev_uptime,
    (prev_uptime - uptime_seconds) as uptime_drop
  FROM uptime_analysis
  WHERE prev_uptime IS NOT NULL 
    AND prev_uptime > uptime_seconds
    AND (prev_uptime - uptime_seconds) > 300  -- At least 5 min drop
    AND EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (timestamp - prev_timestamp)) < 300  -- Data points within 5 min
),
reboot_events AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    host_name,
    LAG(timestamp) OVER (PARTITION BY host_name ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_reboot_time
  FROM reboot_candidates
),
filtered_reboots AS (
  SELECT 
    host_name,
    timestamp
  FROM reboot_events
  WHERE prev_reboot_time IS NULL  -- First reboot for this host
     OR timestamp > prev_reboot_time + INTERVAL '10 minutes'  -- At least 10 min gap
),
reboot_counts AS (
  SELECT 
    host_name,
    COUNT(*) as reboot_count
  FROM filtered_reboots
  GROUP BY host_name
)
SELECT 
  ah.host_name as "Host",
  COALESCE(rc.reboot_count, 0) as "Reboots"
FROM all_hosts ah
LEFT JOIN reboot_counts rc ON ah.host_name = rc.host_name
ORDER BY ah.host_name

WITH latest_host_metrics AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT ON (host_name) 
    host_name,
    cpu_temperature_celsius,
    timestamp
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name != 'server'
    AND cpu_temperature_celsius IS NOT NULL
    AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  ORDER BY host_name, timestamp DESC
)
SELECT 
  host_name as "Host",
  ROUND(cpu_temperature_celsius, 1) as "Temperature"
FROM latest_host_metrics
ORDER BY host_name

WITH hosts_in_timerange AS (
    -- Only get hosts that have sent data within the selected time range
    SELECT DISTINCT host_name 
    FROM system_metrics 
    WHERE host_name IS NOT NULL 
      AND host_name != 'server'
      AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
),
recent_pings AS (
    -- Get the most recent ping for each host within selected time range
    SELECT 
        host_name,
        MAX(timestamp) as last_ping
    FROM system_metrics 
    WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)
      AND host_name != 'server'
    GROUP BY host_name
)
SELECT 
    h.host_name as "metric",
    CASE 
        WHEN rp.last_ping IS NULL THEN 0
        ELSE 1
    END as "value"
FROM hosts_in_timerange h
LEFT JOIN recent_pings rp ON h.host_name = rp.host_name
ORDER BY h.host_name
SELECT critical_incidents as "Critical Incidents" FROM active_incidents_summary
SELECT COUNT(*) as "Low Availability Devices" FROM device_availability_summary WHERE is_low_availability = 1
SELECT active_incidents as "Active Incidents" FROM active_incidents_summary
SELECT new_incidents_5min as "New Incidents (5min)" FROM active_incidents_summary

SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp) as time, 
  host_name as metric, 
  AVG(cpu_percent::float) as value 
FROM system_device_metrics 
WHERE host_name != 'server'
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp), host_name
ORDER BY time

SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp) as time, 
  host_name as metric, 
  AVG(memory_percent::float) as value 
FROM system_device_metrics 
WHERE host_name != 'server'
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp), host_name
ORDER BY time

WITH latest_host_metrics AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT ON (host_name) 
    host_name,
    disk_percent,
    timestamp
  FROM system_device_metrics 
  WHERE host_name != 'server'
    AND capture_folder IS NOT NULL 
    AND capture_folder != 'invalid_config'
    AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  ORDER BY host_name, timestamp DESC
)
SELECT 
  NOW() as time,
  host_name as metric, 
  ROUND(disk_percent, 1) as value 
FROM latest_host_metrics
ORDER BY host_name;

WITH latest_host_metrics AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT ON (host_name) 
    host_name,
    load_average_1m,
    timestamp
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name != 'server'
    AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  ORDER BY host_name, timestamp DESC
)
SELECT 
  NOW() as time,
  host_name as metric, 
  load_average_1m as value 
FROM latest_host_metrics
ORDER BY host_name;

WITH latest_host_metrics AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT ON (host_name) 
    host_name,
    uptime_seconds,
    timestamp
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name != 'server'
    AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  ORDER BY host_name, timestamp DESC
)
SELECT 
  NOW() as time,
  host_name as metric, 
  uptime_seconds as value 
FROM latest_host_metrics
ORDER BY host_name;

WITH latest_host_metrics AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT ON (host_name) 
    host_name, 
    timestamp, 
    cpu_percent, 
    memory_percent, 
    disk_percent, 
    uptime_seconds 
  FROM system_device_metrics 
  WHERE host_name != 'server'
    AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  ORDER BY host_name, timestamp DESC
) 
SELECT 
  host_name as "Host", 
  ROUND(cpu_percent::numeric, 1) as "CPU %", 
  ROUND(memory_percent::numeric, 1) as "Memory %", 
  ROUND(disk_percent::numeric, 1) as "Disk %", 
  CASE 
    WHEN uptime_seconds < 3600 THEN ROUND(uptime_seconds/60) || 'm' 
    WHEN uptime_seconds < 86400 THEN ROUND(uptime_seconds/3600) || 'h' 
    ELSE ROUND(uptime_seconds/86400) || 'd' 
  END as "Uptime", 
  TO_CHAR(timestamp, 'HH24:MI:SS') as "Last Update" 
FROM latest_host_metrics 
ORDER BY host_name

WITH device_availability AS (
    SELECT 
        device_name,
        COUNT(CASE WHEN ffmpeg_status = 'active' AND monitor_status = 'active' THEN 1 END) as available_pings
    FROM system_device_metrics 
    WHERE host_name != 'server'
      AND timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '24 hours'
    GROUP BY device_name
)
SELECT 
    device_name as "Device",
    ROUND((available_pings * 100.0 / 1440), 0) as "Availability %"
FROM device_availability
ORDER BY device_name;

WITH device_availability AS (
    SELECT 
        device_name,
        COUNT(CASE WHEN ffmpeg_status = 'active' AND monitor_status = 'active' THEN 1 END) as available_pings
    FROM system_device_metrics 
    WHERE host_name != 'server'
      AND timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '24 hours'
    GROUP BY device_name
)
SELECT 
    device_name as "Device",
    ROUND((available_pings * 24.0 / 1440), 0) as "Uptime",
    ROUND(24 - (available_pings * 24.0 / 1440), 0) as "Downtime"
FROM device_availability
ORDER BY device_name;

WITH device_availability AS (
    SELECT 
        device_name,
        COUNT(CASE WHEN ffmpeg_status = 'active' AND monitor_status = 'active' THEN 1 END) as available_pings
    FROM system_device_metrics 
    WHERE host_name != 'server'
      AND timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days'
    GROUP BY device_name
)
SELECT 
    device_name as "Device",
    ROUND((available_pings * 100.0 / 10080), 0) as "Availability %"
FROM device_availability
ORDER BY device_name;

WITH device_availability AS (
    SELECT 
        device_name,
        COUNT(CASE WHEN ffmpeg_status = 'active' AND monitor_status = 'active' THEN 1 END) as available_pings
    FROM system_device_metrics 
    WHERE host_name != 'server'
      AND timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days'
    GROUP BY device_name
)
SELECT 
    device_name as "Device",
    ROUND((available_pings * 7.0 / 10080), 0) as "Uptime",
    ROUND(7 - (available_pings * 7.0 / 10080), 0) as "Downtime"
FROM device_availability
ORDER BY device_name;

WITH device_availability AS (
    SELECT 
        device_name,
        COUNT(CASE WHEN ffmpeg_status = 'active' AND monitor_status = 'active' THEN 1 END) as available_pings
    FROM system_device_metrics 
    WHERE host_name != 'server'
      AND timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '30 days'
    GROUP BY device_name
)
SELECT 
    device_name as "Device",
    ROUND((available_pings * 100.0 / 43200), 0) as "Availability %"
FROM device_availability
ORDER BY device_name;

WITH device_availability AS (
    SELECT 
        device_name,
        COUNT(CASE WHEN ffmpeg_status = 'active' AND monitor_status = 'active' THEN 1 END) as available_pings
    FROM system_device_metrics 
    WHERE host_name != 'server'
      AND timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '30 days'
    GROUP BY device_name
)
SELECT 
    device_name as "Device",
    ROUND((available_pings * 30.0 / 43200), 0) as "Uptime",
    ROUND(30 - (available_pings * 30.0 / 43200), 0) as "Downtime"
FROM device_availability
ORDER BY device_name;

WITH device_availability AS (
    SELECT 
        device_name,
        COUNT(CASE WHEN ffmpeg_status = 'active' AND monitor_status = 'active' THEN 1 END) as available_pings
    FROM system_device_metrics 
    WHERE host_name != 'server'
      AND timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '365 days'
    GROUP BY device_name
)
SELECT 
    device_name as "Device",
    ROUND((available_pings * 100.0 / 525600), 0) as "Availability %"
FROM device_availability
ORDER BY device_name;

WITH device_availability AS (
    SELECT 
        device_name,
        COUNT(CASE WHEN ffmpeg_status = 'active' AND monitor_status = 'active' THEN 1 END) as available_pings
    FROM system_device_metrics 
    WHERE host_name != 'server'
      AND timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '365 days'
    GROUP BY device_name
)
SELECT 
    device_name as "Device",
    ROUND((available_pings * 365.0 / 525600), 0) as "Uptime",
    ROUND(365 - (available_pings * 365.0 / 525600), 0) as "Downtime"
FROM device_availability
ORDER BY device_name;

SELECT 
    host_name as "Host",
    TO_CHAR(timestamp, 'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS') as "Last Update",
    uptime_seconds as "Uptime (sec)",
    
    -- Time conversions
    CASE 
        WHEN uptime_seconds < 3600 THEN ROUND(uptime_seconds/60) || 'm' 
        WHEN uptime_seconds < 86400 THEN ROUND(uptime_seconds/3600, 1) || 'h' 
        ELSE ROUND(uptime_seconds/86400, 1) || 'd' 
    END as "Uptime (formatted)",
    
    cpu_percent as "CPU %",
    memory_percent as "Memory %",
    disk_percent as "Disk %",
    
    -- Host status
    CASE 
        WHEN uptime_seconds > 0 THEN '✅ Online' 
        ELSE '❌ Offline' 
    END as "Host Status"
    
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name != 'server'
ORDER BY timestamp DESC
LIMIT 10;

SELECT 
    host_name as "Host",
    TO_CHAR(timestamp, 'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS') as "Last Update",
    uptime_seconds as "Uptime (sec)",
    
    -- Time conversions
    CASE 
        WHEN uptime_seconds < 3600 THEN ROUND(uptime_seconds/60) || 'm' 
        WHEN uptime_seconds < 86400 THEN ROUND(uptime_seconds/3600, 1) || 'h' 
        ELSE ROUND(uptime_seconds/86400, 1) || 'd' 
    END as "Uptime (formatted)",
    
    cpu_percent as "CPU %",
    memory_percent as "Memory %",
    disk_percent as "Disk %",
    
    -- Host status
    CASE 
        WHEN uptime_seconds > 0 THEN '✅ Online' 
        ELSE '❌ Offline' 
    END as "Host Status"
    
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name != 'server'
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
ORDER BY timestamp DESC
LIMIT 10;

WITH all_hosts AS (
  -- Get all hosts with their first timestamp to show 0 baseline
  SELECT 
    host_name,
    MIN(timestamp) as first_seen
  FROM system_metrics
  WHERE host_name != 'server'
    AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  GROUP BY host_name
),
host_baseline AS (
  -- Create 0 baseline for all hosts at their first appearance
  SELECT 
    first_seen as time,
    host_name as metric,
    0 as value
  FROM all_hosts
),
uptime_analysis AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    uptime_seconds,
    host_name,
    LAG(uptime_seconds) OVER (PARTITION BY host_name ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_uptime,
    LAG(timestamp) OVER (PARTITION BY host_name ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_timestamp
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name != 'server'
    AND uptime_seconds IS NOT NULL
    AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  ORDER BY host_name, timestamp
),
reboot_events AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp as time,
    host_name as metric,
    1 as value,
    uptime_seconds,
    prev_uptime,
    (prev_uptime - uptime_seconds) as uptime_drop
  FROM uptime_analysis
  WHERE prev_uptime IS NOT NULL
    AND prev_uptime > uptime_seconds  -- Uptime decreased
    AND (prev_uptime - uptime_seconds) > 300  -- At least 5 min drop (reboot indicator)
    AND EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (timestamp - prev_timestamp)) < 300  -- Data points within 5 min of each other
)
SELECT time, metric, value FROM host_baseline
UNION ALL
SELECT time, metric, value FROM reboot_events
ORDER BY time

SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp) as time, 
  host_name as metric, 
  AVG(cpu_temperature_celsius::float) as value 
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name != 'server'
  AND cpu_temperature_celsius IS NOT NULL
  AND timestamp >= $__timeFrom()
  AND timestamp <= $__timeTo()
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp), host_name
ORDER BY time

WITH latest_host_metrics AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT ON (host_name) 
    host_name,
    ffmpeg_service_uptime_seconds,
    monitor_service_uptime_seconds,
    timestamp
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name != 'server'
    AND (ffmpeg_service_uptime_seconds IS NOT NULL OR monitor_service_uptime_seconds IS NOT NULL)
    AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  ORDER BY host_name, timestamp DESC
),
service_uptime_data AS (
  SELECT host_name, 'FFmpeg' as service, ffmpeg_service_uptime_seconds as uptime_seconds FROM latest_host_metrics WHERE ffmpeg_service_uptime_seconds IS NOT NULL
  UNION ALL
  SELECT host_name, 'Monitor' as service, monitor_service_uptime_seconds as uptime_seconds FROM latest_host_metrics WHERE monitor_service_uptime_seconds IS NOT NULL
)
SELECT 
  NOW() as time,
  CONCAT(host_name, ' - ', service) as metric,
  uptime_seconds as value
FROM service_uptime_data
ORDER BY host_name, service;

WITH ffmpeg_uptime_analysis AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp, host_name, ffmpeg_service_uptime_seconds,
    LAG(ffmpeg_service_uptime_seconds) OVER (PARTITION BY host_name ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_uptime
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name != 'server' AND ffmpeg_service_uptime_seconds IS NOT NULL
    AND timestamp >= $__timeFrom() AND timestamp <= $__timeTo()
),
monitor_uptime_analysis AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp, host_name, monitor_service_uptime_seconds,
    LAG(monitor_service_uptime_seconds) OVER (PARTITION BY host_name ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_uptime
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name != 'server' AND monitor_service_uptime_seconds IS NOT NULL
    AND timestamp >= $__timeFrom() AND timestamp <= $__timeTo()
),
ffmpeg_restarts AS (
  SELECT host_name, timestamp, 'FFmpeg' as service
  FROM ffmpeg_uptime_analysis
  WHERE prev_uptime IS NOT NULL AND prev_uptime > ffmpeg_service_uptime_seconds
    AND (prev_uptime - ffmpeg_service_uptime_seconds) > 300
),
monitor_restarts AS (
  SELECT host_name, timestamp, 'Monitor' as service
  FROM monitor_uptime_analysis
  WHERE prev_uptime IS NOT NULL AND prev_uptime > monitor_service_uptime_seconds
    AND (prev_uptime - monitor_service_uptime_seconds) > 300
),
all_restarts AS (
  SELECT * FROM ffmpeg_restarts
  UNION ALL
  SELECT * FROM monitor_restarts
),
filtered_restarts AS (
  SELECT 
    host_name, service, timestamp,
    LAG(timestamp) OVER (PARTITION BY host_name, service ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_restart
  FROM all_restarts
),
final_restarts AS (
  SELECT host_name, service
  FROM filtered_restarts
  WHERE prev_restart IS NULL OR timestamp > prev_restart + INTERVAL '5 minutes'
)
SELECT 
  CONCAT(host_name, ' - ', service) as "Host - Service",
  COUNT(*) as "Restarts"
FROM final_restarts
GROUP BY host_name, service
ORDER BY host_name, service

WITH ffmpeg_uptime_analysis AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    ffmpeg_service_uptime_seconds,
    host_name,
    LAG(ffmpeg_service_uptime_seconds) OVER (PARTITION BY host_name ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_uptime
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name != 'server'
    AND ffmpeg_service_uptime_seconds IS NOT NULL
    AND timestamp >= $__timeFrom()
    AND timestamp <= $__timeTo()
  ORDER BY host_name, timestamp
),
monitor_uptime_analysis AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    monitor_service_uptime_seconds,
    host_name,
    LAG(monitor_service_uptime_seconds) OVER (PARTITION BY host_name ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_uptime
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name != 'server'
    AND monitor_service_uptime_seconds IS NOT NULL
    AND timestamp >= $__timeFrom()
    AND timestamp <= $__timeTo()
  ORDER BY host_name, timestamp
),
ffmpeg_restart_candidates AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    host_name,
    ffmpeg_service_uptime_seconds,
    prev_uptime,
    (prev_uptime - ffmpeg_service_uptime_seconds) as uptime_drop
  FROM ffmpeg_uptime_analysis
  WHERE prev_uptime IS NOT NULL 
    AND prev_uptime > ffmpeg_service_uptime_seconds
    AND (prev_uptime - ffmpeg_service_uptime_seconds) > 300  -- 5 min significant drop
),
monitor_restart_candidates AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    host_name,
    monitor_service_uptime_seconds,
    prev_uptime,
    (prev_uptime - monitor_service_uptime_seconds) as uptime_drop
  FROM monitor_uptime_analysis
  WHERE prev_uptime IS NOT NULL 
    AND prev_uptime > monitor_service_uptime_seconds
    AND (prev_uptime - monitor_service_uptime_seconds) > 300  -- 5 min significant drop
),
ffmpeg_restart_events AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    host_name,
    'FFmpeg' as service,
    LAG(timestamp) OVER (PARTITION BY host_name ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_restart_time
  FROM ffmpeg_restart_candidates
),
monitor_restart_events AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    host_name,
    'Monitor' as service,
    LAG(timestamp) OVER (PARTITION BY host_name ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_restart_time
  FROM monitor_restart_candidates
),
filtered_ffmpeg_restarts AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp as time,
    CONCAT(host_name, ' - FFmpeg') as metric,
    1 as value
  FROM ffmpeg_restart_events
  WHERE prev_restart_time IS NULL  -- First restart for this host
     OR timestamp > prev_restart_time + INTERVAL '5 minutes'  -- At least 5 min gap
),
filtered_monitor_restarts AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp as time,
    CONCAT(host_name, ' - Monitor') as metric,
    2 as value  -- Different value for visual distinction
  FROM monitor_restart_events
  WHERE prev_restart_time IS NULL  -- First restart for this host
     OR timestamp > prev_restart_time + INTERVAL '5 minutes'  -- At least 5 min gap
),
all_service_restarts AS (
  SELECT * FROM filtered_ffmpeg_restarts
  UNION ALL
  SELECT * FROM filtered_monitor_restarts
)
SELECT 
  time,
  metric,
  value
FROM all_service_restarts
ORDER BY time

SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp) as time, 
  host_name as metric, 
  AVG(disk_write_mb_per_sec::float) as value 
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name != 'server'
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp), host_name
ORDER BY time

WITH latest_host_metrics AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT ON (host_name) 
    host_name,
    download_mbps,
    upload_mbps,
    timestamp
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name != 'server'
    AND download_mbps IS NOT NULL
    AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  ORDER BY host_name, timestamp DESC
),
network_data AS (
  SELECT host_name, 'Download' as metric_type, download_mbps as speed FROM latest_host_metrics
  UNION ALL
  SELECT host_name, 'Upload' as metric_type, upload_mbps as speed FROM latest_host_metrics
)
SELECT 
  NOW() as time,
  CONCAT(host_name, ' - ', metric_type) as metric,
  speed as value
FROM network_data
ORDER BY host_name, metric_type ASC;

SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp) as time,
  host_name as metric,
  AVG(download_mbps) as value
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name != 'server'
  AND download_mbps IS NOT NULL
  AND download_mbps > 0
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp), host_name
ORDER BY time, host_name

SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp) as time,
  host_name as metric,
  AVG(upload_mbps) as value
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name != 'server'
  AND upload_mbps IS NOT NULL
  AND upload_mbps > 0
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp), host_name
ORDER BY time, host_name

SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp) as time,
  host_name as metric,
  AVG(uptime_seconds) as value
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name != 'server'
  AND uptime_seconds IS NOT NULL
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp), host_name
ORDER BY time, host_name

SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp) as time,
  host_name as metric,
  AVG(download_mbps) as value
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name != 'server'
  AND download_mbps IS NOT NULL
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp), host_name
ORDER BY time, host_name

SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp) as time,
  host_name as metric,
  AVG(upload_mbps) as value
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name != 'server'
  AND upload_mbps IS NOT NULL
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp), host_name
ORDER BY time, host_name

title: System Host Monitoring
